title: Best Mall of Kolkata
review_text: This mall is located near Park Circus. It is in the heart of the city. People come here to shop, eat, play and watch movies. Here you will find INOX to watch movies.

title: Beautiful brand mall
review_text: You will find all kinds of international and local brand products. Often you will get promo discounts. There is a grocery shop in the basement. If you are a Traveller the best way is to travel there by a taxi. I would recommend to go during the day hours since it's less crowded.

title: Good shops and Good Food Court
review_text: I liked this mall on my recent trip to Kolkata. There are shops to cater to all your needs (even grocery) and then there is this nice food court with so many food options to choose from.

title: The Amazing Quest
review_text:
Such a beautifull well stocked mall with famous brands . 
The collections are absouletly good and new. 
We always look forward to quest .

title: Nice mall
review_text: One of the best mall in kolkata. Good for shopping, eatouts and hangout place. We have been there for movies which was a good experience for us.

title: Good Mall
review_text: This is of the newest and biggest mall in Kolkata.You can enjoy shopping here.Lot of food joints are also there.

title: Really good experience
review_text: Surprised to find a superbly well stocked Burberry shop in India which had our rare collection wallet in stock which was sold out in all of Australia... The mall itself is quite impressive in size and shop's offerings..

title: Good place for last moment buys
review_text: The mall has Spencer's, basically like a Carrefour. So you can buy some last minute chocolates, Haldiram's, and many other things that you might have wanted to get from Kolkata to take back home. They also have Lifestyle, a clothes shop, which offers many branded products at discounted prices. A good place food some good quality buys.

title: Good Place for shopping from branded store
review_text: The building of quest mall is well designed, very nicely decorated. It is a perfect place for do shopping from the branded stores. Clothes collection of the available stores are good. Food court in the top floor is pocket friendly though the movie ticket price is bit costly in the multiplex.

title: Nice place for quality shopping
review_text:
A good shopping place in Kolkata! 
You will get quality and brand items for shopping here. 
Spacious, nicely decorated and not so crowdy place for shoppers.

title: Quest
review_text: This is a nice well decorated mall with many foreign brands in Kolkata.Top floor for foodies and for movie lovers.

title: Beautifullly Build | Each Level is designed based on the Brand Value Levels
review_text: Very Structured, huge and easy movement mall. The ground floor is all international brands with high to medium range products and outlets. The second floor is the relative mediocre brand which are Indian premium brands like Solly, LP. The 3rd floor is the most common brands with lot of accessories brands. The last floor is movie thetre. So, you will find all sort of crowd here.

title: Lots of foreign brands
review_text: Quest Mall is a nice well decorated mall in Kolkata with lots of foreign brands.But don't worry local company Spencer with others also here.Top floor for foodies and movie lovers.

title: One of the best
review_text: Had everything you are looking fot in a mall. Especially enjoyed going to a movie here on my recent trip.

title: Great modern shopping mall
review_text: Very modern and clean. All name brands under one roof including a great supermarket Spencers - spent a bit of time browsing, prices were quite reasonable, awesome selection of goodies and well stocked, marked and priced. Amenities clean and maintained and easily accessible.

title: food court disorganization

title: Best for youngsters

title: Mall with foreign brands
review_text: Quest Mall is a well decorated mall.You can see many foreign brands here.Their is a cinema hall and food court for foodies in this mall.

title: Shopper's paradise
review_text: I quite love this place. You can find anything and everything there. Of course this a high-end mall, not for everybody. If you love reading, visit Starmarks, for grocery Spencer, I absolutely love Life Style. There food court and INOX are fab too!

title: Most brand available, centrally located
review_text: This mall is new and has all the premium brands. The PVR is also one of the best with Insignia theater. The eateries are several and excellent.

title: Hang outs best medicine

title: Expensive

However, options for reasonably priced items aplenty, along with a food court. Spencers supermarket is here, where one can find all types of essentials. The mall bathrooms are spotless and nice and cool inside the mall. Beat the heat!

title: Unarguably the best mall in Kolkata
review_text: It is pretty good, with a wide variety of options ! I especially love the fact that you will find something for everyone here. The spencers here is fabulous and the food options are plenty. A good visit.

title: a great mall to visit
review_text: we were there in kolkata for a day and had visited quest mall.. it has almost all the high ended brands which is available in kolkata...its a mall for the rich....

title: This is eastern India s biggest mall
review_text: This is eastern India s biggest mall hosting premium international brand shops. The place is nicely designed and ambience of the place is great. The mall has a premium multiplex and the food court and fine dining restaurant at the top floor is quite a buzz

title: Awful luxury place, no soul, awkward feeling
review_text:
I was looking for a mall to buy gifts. 

I found this place because of all the good feedbacks in tripadvisor. This was a mistake. 

After having been in the crazy streets of Kolkata, with people sleeping all around, you are suddently in a luxury temple. 

No one in the stores which are even way to expensive for a european guy like me. 

People are just here to look at those products that they will never be able to afford. 

And then you have to go back in the outside true life. Awkward feeling. 

One star for the good irish bar at the 5th floor. Expensive but 1 glass paid, 1 offered during the happy hour. More

title: Quest Mall Central Calcutta
review_text: Located near the Park Circus crossing, this mall is located in the heart of Calcutta and houses big international brands like Gucci. Nice ambience, high end brands, overall a good experience. Highly recommended.

title: Excellent Mall
review_text: One of the famous and best quality mall in city of joy, Kolkata. it covered big area with huge collection of items. All types of international brands are available here. Outside look of the mall is quite attractive at the night. Varieties of food with good quality are also available. Nice place to hang out with friends or family.

title: Mall with nice ambience and brand shops
review_text: You will love the place, say it for a window shopping visit or a movie or some real buying. All the shops looked good to me. Things are costly here to buy, but quality demands price... ain't it? Personally, bought some stuff from the mother care shop for my son and he is loving those items. But, honestly felt like buying the whole shop as the collection was really good.

title: one of among best malls in Kolkata.
review_text: Very cool ambience. Located in central Kolkata. Most luxury brands have their store in here.Theres is food court too.

title: Our weekend destination - almost every week.
review_text:
We get everything here - from Kool Kidz to Outlets for shopping to multiplex to Food Court to fine dining restaurants. Parking is good. 

Elevators - the waiting time, every time is very long as people call elevator by pressing both (up and down) keys all the time - resulting into elevators stopping at each levels while going up or down. 2 of the elevators do not serve food court and higher levels. A lot of time is wasted in and around elevators (the only minus here). Otherwise location is good and mall is clean and well maintained.

title: Among the 2 best malls of Kolkata
review_text:
Quest Mall is among the 2 best malls of Kolkata (along with South City). All the major brands including B&O, Bose, Gucci etc. are present here. Food court offers a wide array of food. ALso restaurants like Irish Cafe, Yuatcha, Chili's etc are present here. 
My visit this time was restricted to movie viewing in Inox and lunch at food court

title: Good interior mall
review_text: quest mall is located in the park circus of kolkata.the mall featured lots of brands and local stores .good mall for shopping

title: Nike horrifying

title: Nice and Awesome Place to Visit
review_text: Quest Mall has all type of international brands but the price is very costly. It has a very good food court.You can shop , have snacks at food court, watch a movie and buy groceries on your way back.

title: Expensively merchandise
review_text: Quest is an upscale mall with lots of brand name shops. Pretty big with 4-5 floors. One will need tons of money to buy stuff otherwise it's a pleasant place for browsing and just walk around. The food court is also good.

title: Quest Mall
review_text: Quest Mall has all type of international brands. but the price is costly. whose starting price is from rs 10000

Gucci, Burberry, Swarovski what's not there!! We just kept on checking them. The ambience was good. If you are not in the shopping mood, you can go top floor to enjoy movies at Inox.

review_text:
It is really the “5 Star Mall”. All are international Brands whose starting prices start at Rs. 10000. 
It has INOX Insignia that provides a waiting lounge and an invaluable service. It has a number of restaurants and shops.

title: Shop till you drop.
review_text: Quest mall is a mall which accommodates brands like Burberry, jimmy choo and Gucci along with other mid ranged and lower ranged brands

title: Great place for brand shopping, grocery, food and movies
review_text: You can shop at the many brand stores here, have snacks at the varied food court, watch a movie and buy groceries on your way back.

As for the shops most are high end 'international' brands - available anywhere so nothing special. Of the others Fabindia is good the the rest so so.

title: Nice Place to Visit

title: I must confess
review_text: I really must confess that I am in love with quest mall basically I am in love with Starmark. its a great place for buying books, options are limitless, fully thumbs up

title: Not a big mall
review_text: Not a big mall. But most of high fashion outlets there. We can spent some quality time here. Nothing special to mention.

title: Best mall so far
review_text: The interior, cleanliness, shops and restaurants at Quest make it such an ideal mall to go on and hangout at. Even though prices are a little on the high side in most shops, the food court offers a wide range of multi cuisine food at normal prices.

title: Amazing mall in Quaint Kolkatta
review_text: One stop shop for women- for clothes, accessories to makeup and watches, books. From designer labels to ethnic wear. Loved being there. Food options also nice. Large mall but not tooo large. Security was good too which is always reassuring

title: High end Mall
review_text:
This mall is very well decorated. 
Lots of high end brands- Gucci, Armani, expensive watches- omega, rolex etc, are there. nike, adidas, puma is also there. 
There is also a super chain shop. where you can find lots of good deals of both gender. Shirts, Formal shirts, jeans are on discounts.

title: Comfort Cafe ~ Q 33 @ Quest Mall
review_text:
I have been trying to locate Q 33 independently and could not find it. 
What a pity! 
It certaibly deserves solo recognition. 

The place to chill our heels after a hectic shopping spree with the most awesome coffees snacks salads and desserts, Q 33 is indeed Cafe Comfort. 

Located on ground level this open cafe is what cafes should be. 
A cool place to chill. 

Lovely!

title: cool place!!
review_text: A good mall with lots and lots of eating places along with a variety of shops. There is also a multiplex for the movie goers!

title: One hell of an Hangout High End Mall...
review_text: I can Quest is a High end mall, Gucci, Jimmy Choo & Armani. Inox has Insignia. Good food restaurants. Best part is Shopping for some luxury goods. I can confess I did fall for an Emporio Armani watch.

title: Nice Places to Eat, Chill and Shop!
review_text:
Quest is a relatively newer mall in Kolkata. It is quite big and a lot of pretty great brands. Several places to eat, a multiplex to watch a movie etc. Just a generally nice vibe. 

You might want to avoid the place during off hours, there is some really weird crowd.

title: Very nice mall

Location is in center of the city .All well known brands ( Gucci, Burberry,Kenneth cole )as well as lifestyle store,spencers are there.Food area is also vast and divided in upper and lower segments.Common seating is on 4 th floor and fine dining Restaurants are on 5 th floor.So for any small get-together or any party people can come here.Kid's stuff are also available on 3 rd floor as there are various shops including Little shop which os big name in Calcutta.I hope this review is helpful.

title: Beautiful

title: Nice mall,but expensive to say the least
review_text:
This Mall has been projected as a one stop shopping experience for all your premium needs. Most international reputed brands like Gucci to Calvin Klein are listed here. 

Make no mistake,that this is just another mall in the city,but way to expensive than anywhere else in Kolkata. I'll give my own experience when I went to buy jeans from Levis store situated inside the Mall. One jeans which caught my fancy was selling for Rs 3600 after discount. I found the price ridiculous. Hence walked away,simply saying didn't like it. Next day bought two jeans of Levis staruss,same model 511 from Mtero Cash and Carry for Rs 1400 and Rs 1600 !! So I got two jeans for the price of one,from the same Company ! Why spend more here ?You will if you want to splurge your undisclosed income ! 
' 
Restaurants are expensive too. Parking space is huge but refrain from taking your S-class and 7 series as the access way up and down parking lot is a winding way,and you actually may get stuck ! I saw a S-350 getting stuck. 

The place is a hangout zone for locals. Hnece gets crowded in the evenings as well as on weekends. 

Frankly,I have been there.Probably won't visit again More

review_text: It is great place to do shopping in Calcutta. The place is clean and shops provide a good choice to buy designer clothing. Awful approach road

title: Amazing

title: Ecstatic

Went there to watch a movie but one cannot miss the opportunity of viewing around the mall because it is so well built and nice. 
In terms of its attractiveness its the vest Mall in Kolkata

title: Excellent High End mall

The best thing about the mall is that is very large and is not cramped. All international brand stores are available at this joint. Though the ambience of the food court is good, I felt it lacked variety. The top floor has a Inox Cineplex. More

title: A premium luxury mall
review_text:
This a luxury Mall of Kolkata...all high end luxury brands are available here like Gucci, Bulgari, Tumi, Armani, H&M, Canali, Burberry, Jimmy Choo...all these shops are present in the ground and first level... 
The basement is totally taken over by Spencer's and a part of it is the mall office... 
This mall is pretty new...as it opened in 2013... 
The first outlet of the American fast-casual bakery and café chain Au Bon Pain also opened at this mall... 
Also Lifestyle opened their first outlet of Kolkata here only... 
There is a six screen plex of Inox which included one Gold Class screen... 
There is huge paid parking space spread over six levels... 
The food court is nice and huge...and has some fine dining options like Yauatcha, Serefina, Bombay Brasserie... 
Also there is an outlet of a pub The Irish House... 
the entry gate is revolving glass gate..something seen in European Malls... 
Also there is a fountain in the lobby area... 
And there is a lawn on the 7th floor terrace which generally plays host to ISL after match parties... More

title: All under one roof
review_text:
One of the main reasons I frequent this mall so much, is that everything is literally under one roof. Theres a department store in the basement, snack food like popcorn, kulfi, milkshakes etc, a party shop, coffee shop. The ground floor has luxury shopping and boasts brands such as canali, jimmy choo, Michael kors, Swarovski, thecollective, etc. The other floors have regular brands like Fabindia, ritu Kumar label, Benetton, Mac, Calvin Klein, Claire's etc. The kids section is on the 3rd floor - little shop, uspa, holdover kids etc. 
There's also a multiplex -INOX and a food court which offers quite a variety - from chaat to Chinese and fast food. Besides, this there are other coffee shops in the mall as well. The fifth floor has fine dining and pubs - Irish house, Bombay brasserie, serafina and the city's only Michelin star restaurant - yauatcha 
The only annoying part is the crowds taking selfies and blocking the foyer on holidays and weekends and the mismanaged parking during peak hours. More

title: Brand names galore!
review_text:

People visit malls not just for shopping but also to have fun such as a good place to rest your heels when you are tired. I find Quest very cramped for space. To begin with, parking is extremely cramped and the circular driveway is so narrow that it is downright scary, if you happen to have a big car. I wish the management had been more innovative with the Foodcourt, starting from the design, seating arrangements, selection of food stores and variety available. If you are looking for a good cup of Capuccino, there is no good cafe in the main food court ... there is a good one - Q33 - but you will have to go to the ground floor for it. Au bon pain is there in the food court but it is not exactly a coffee place. There are some good restaurants, though. Basement has Spencers supermarket (hyper store) but space wise it is a smaller version of the one in South City. Starmark bookstore is also located in the basement, but again the design of the space is such that it does not generate the excitement and interest as it could have.... title: High end mall, but the hypermarket is a daily draw
review_text:
This is a huge mall with most of the uber luxury brands present here. At the same time it contains two mid-range stores, Spencer's and a clothing store occupying five floors, among the largest in the country. The Spencer's hypermart is huge, spanning the entire basement, and offering every conceivable household item. The food section has to be noted for the range and quality of items, from fresh fish, in-house bakery, a butchers, to fresh, frozen and canned foods sourced from all over the world, plus the daily essentials. If you live nearby, then this is the best place to buy your daily grocery needs. 

The top floor food court has restaurants to fit every palate, but no cheap eats. The mall is worth visiting just for the food choices available here. Cleanliness and maintenance is top-notch. There is an attached massive multi-level parking, with direct access into the mall. 

The luxury brand shops are eye catching but not for every pocket. They are good to window shop, but the great food and the Inox multiplex make this mall a must visit destination. More

review_text: One of my favourite malls in the city, it houses brands like Burberry, Michael Kors, Swarovski, canali, furla, tag heuer, etc on the ground floor, grocery shopping and a well-stocked wine shop (Spencer's), party supplies, star mark in the basement and all the other popular brands like mango, Tommy Hilfiger, wills lifestyle, satya Paul, mac and much more spread across the other floors. Grab a movie at INOX to kill time - this is the only multiplex to give u the luxurious insignia option and grab a meal at the food court or any of the fine dining restaurants on the 5th floor!

title: glitz and glamor
review_text: this place lights up the shopper as soon as they step in. the 5 star ambience has something for every shopper. best to visit during festivities for the intelligent decor.

title: Best Mall in Kolkata
review_text: This is hands down the best mall in kolkata be it the decor,selection of brands, food court or anything else you are looking for. A complete family experience

title: An oasis of luxury
review_text: High end mall, with many luxury brand outlets...food court with various local and international options, with all the usual suspects, like pizza hut and KFC...in any case a nice air-conditioned retreat from the heat and chaos and noise from the streets of kolkata!

title: a brilliant new mall near AJC bose Road n Park street
review_text:
This is one of the newest mall which is a walking distance from AJC bose road and 5-10 min from taxi. 

The mall has all the major brands including some premium brands as well. Has all the amenities that a mall shoudl have. Also the food court is quite good with 10-15 options. 

A couple of restaurant and pubs are also there in this mall.

title: Mast mall hai bhai
review_text: It is really a beautiful architecture in Kolkata. Amazing beauty added to the beauty of Kolkata. Pin to elephant is available and is of extremely good quality. It is located in the heart of the city.

title: an oasis in chaotic city
review_text: What a relief to find a high end mall in the middle of bustling and dusty Kolkata. Good place to chill out and have meals and spend your time.

title: High end shopping.....
review_text: One of the best malls I've visited in India... Shoppers Paradise but beware this is high end shopping...!!! Almost all brands are available...!!! It has a food court which offers good food...!!! Excellent place to spend time....

title: Best Mall seen till date
review_text: This is the Best Mall I hv seen in Kolkata during my visit this Sept 2015. Biggest Brands u will find and the Food Park zone is great. Cinema zone is superb.

title: The Quest - East India's Largest Mall
review_text: Spread over 7.3 Lacs sq feet, this is one of the finest luxury malls in the country. Lifestyle and Spencer's being the 2 major anchors alone covers more than 30% of the area. It has also got Kolkata's finest Inox of 6 screens and a lot of luxury foreign brands. Top most floor consists of some of the best restaurants, below that is Inox and rest are shop outlets of various brands. We often visit there for movies in Inox. It's just 15 minutes by walk and 5 minutes by auto rickshaw from my home.

title: Fine mall, new, modern that has it all
review_text:
This must be the place to be, it has it all.. expensive though (such ad Gucci) but still a wide range of things of good quality... 

And enough places to eat. 

Good for shopping and escaping the heat.

title: High end mall, quite snooty though.
review_text:
This mall is great if you have a bundle of cash to burn through. 
The shops here are all high end and i might as well be shopping in an international duty free section of an airport. 
Too many security and staff here make it feel claustrophobic, but the air conditioning was a welcome relief. 

We did find a wine shop here and bought some Indian red wine which was pretty good, though when we went to get a drink upstairs it was not a good choice. 
I recommend that you steer clear of the Green Mango Ice Gola unless you have seriously damaged your taste buds somewhere else. 

The mall is great for those with too much money or those who just want to gawp in to expensive shops... but for the average person, head to the Forum Mall, it's less high end but much nicer in my opinion. More

title: Expensive Mall
review_text: This mall is located in Park Circus Avenue. This mall is basically targeted towards the super rich in Kolkata. Shops are mostly boutiques and designer garment shops. Parking charges, fooding prices and Multiplex tickets are the highest in Kolkata. Only shop i like is Lifestyle. Au Bon Pain is a nice cafe on the food court.

title: Nice mall having many top brands shop
review_text: Quest mall is located in Park Circus areas . It is a nice mall having many top brands shops of clothes,Shoes, kids apparals , crockery items etc. The food court of this mall is small compare to other good malls. Restaurants are nice and well decorated. In overall a wonderful place for shopping, enjoyment and entertainment.

title: Kolkata's Luxury outing!
review_text:
Well, Kolkata, is quiet a traditional city, even until know, one can feel the flavor of early decades, however, this one particular mall, is quiet a change and it is quiet nice, big and spacious, something to compare with malls from North India, During my recent visit, to the city of Joy, i surely has a good visit to the mall. 

I must say, the Multiples, inside was world class, really good facility, along with movie experience, also the food court, was a good mix of Restaurants, where from Bengali traditional food to multi cuisine dishes were available. 

Though on the top most floor, there were some some amazing international fine dinning along with lounges were available. Which gives a choice to any walk in, as you get adjust yourself to any category of your choice. 

the mall looks very new and fresh and i am sure, in coming days, it will surely become the highlight of Kolkata. More

title: SHOPPING MALL WITH TOP NOTCH BRANDS
review_text: It is considered to be a Mall housing top notch national and international brands in clothes,leather goods,sunglasses etc.The location of the Mall is in the heart of city and massive parking place is available.Good place to spend some quality time during weekends.There are some good food joints also for the shoppers.

title: A Range of Branded Stores!
review_text: If you are looking to buy branded clothes, shoes, sunglasses etc., then this is the right place to shop. You will find many different brands, both national and international. I noticed that the staff members in each store were friendly, helpful and giving plenty of time to each customer. I enjoyed my shopping experience at Quest. However, unlike South City, I don't see myself returning here too often.

title: Attractive luxury mall + good eating options.
review_text:
We visited Kolkata for catching a flight to Bangkok. 
We had a day to spend in Kolkata but it started raining heavily and Quest Mall became our safe haven! 
It is beautifully made, luxury mall with good eating options at its food court. 
The mall itself is not very big nor is its food court but essentially supplies the basic needs (FOOOOOD! and shopping if you are willing.) 
Overall, it is a nice mall which you can visit on your free time in Kolkata.

title: Luxury Mall of Kolkata
review_text: Quest Mall, Luxury Mall of Kolkata which proudly houses many International Luxury Brands along with upmarket international brands. Nice Food Court adds value to this place.

title: LUXARY PRODUCTS UNDER ONE ROOF
review_text: It seems kolkata finally got a luxary mall like palladium mall in mumbai. Located in Ballygund & near to park circus crosssing. Most of the luxary brands like Apple,Bluberry,Gucci,Rolex, Omega,Emperio Armani,Indian by Manish Arora,Satya Paul,Estee Lauder,Paul Smith to regular brands like Wills Lifestyle,Lifestyle,Puma,Nike etc. Inox decoration also best in Kolkata. If you are looking internation products & taste different visit Quest.

title: Upmarket Shopping in Kolkata
review_text: One of the new upmarket shopping complexes in Kolkata. Easy to find with many options available to get at the place from other areas in the city. Comparatively the goods are priced higher than in other complexes, yet the quality appear to be better. Do not miss the grocery shopping area in the basement which is highly patronized by the local community.You will be able to find typical Bengali spices, pickles, chutneys and dried fruits /nuts.

title: Perfect destination for Brand freaks

It's not just these brands are expensive here but on an average it is quite expensive than its other counterparts. From parking to movie, everywhere you have to spend some extra bucks.

title: good but very very costly

title: Great mall..
review_text:

The mall has lots of famous brands to choose from. It has a big Lifestyle store, lots of restaurants, a large and great food court. Other items would include Inox Cinema, The Thai Spa, A N John (saloon), Spencers, Starmark, etc. 
There is plenty of (paid) parking space, though best place to park would be close to the mall entrance doors, else you have to navigate through another set of elevators. If you're planning to go to Spencer's Hypermart, then do park at the basement. 
On the downside, it gets really crowded in the weekends and holidays and crowd isn't that great. More

title: Luxury Mall in the Heart of Kolkata
review_text:
A latest entrant in the 'Mall-Ecosystem' of Kolkata. Situated in the heart of the city (near Park Circus 7-point crossing), the Mall has paid a lot of attention to its decor and the choice of Retail brands. 
The huge revolving glass door at the entrance has caught the fancy of the average Kolkatan entering the mall 
The effort has been to position itself as a 'Luxury Mall', with the likes of Gucci, Armani, Burberry, Paul Smith, etc acquiring retail space at the mall. 'Lifestyle' is the Anchor-retailer of the Mall and has the maximum floor space (spread across 4 levels). 
The Food Court is big (not as huge as in South City) and has good Food options. But would prefer more options. 
The Top-floor has some great Restaurants and a Pub (the Irish House), which can be pretty crowded on weekends! 
In short, Quest is a great addition to the city and the City needed it! More

title: Just Hype...Not Even Basic Things Right
review_text:
Been To quest Mall on sunday around 11 am For a movie @ INOX Quest Mall . after the movie decided to have my lunch also at the mall but..... 

Being the newest mall in city and one which created a lot of hype lacks basic things 

1st when i was parking my car at level P4 a street dog was roaming there, i was quite surprised by and security guard was quick to reply - kya karen sir jab tab aa jaten hai. 

2nd toilets are in very poor state. on 4th floor opposite food court cash counter there is a toilet and was really shocked to see only 2 urinals in men's toilet with no soap dispenser and no hand dryer. now days even in a movie hall you expect these basic amenities but did not find them in a mall which calls itself a luxury mall. i tried contacting mall officials but could not locate. 

3rd - Parking lay out is really miserable. separate lifts for parking levels and that too available after a long wait. not even a single security out side exit gate 5 to manage the cars leaving the mall and that results a complete chaos on the road. 

its a request to concerned people to look after these small issues but of big importance and an advice to fellow commuters. More

title: International standard mall
review_text: The only mall in Calcutta which is of international standard in terms of decor and design, and of course in terms of brands on offer. Even if you do not want to buy expensive international brands, the mall is worth visiting for the food court alone. The food is affordable and delicious. Lifestyle, Starmark and Spencers are the anchor brands and have big outlets.

title: Brand and High End Shopping
review_text: New in Kolkata, this mall is in the heart of the city and is a cool place where you can disappear from the soaring temperatures of the city. It is a high end shopping mall with well known brands that will burn a hole in your pocket. A great food court with some good food at competitive prices and some very good luxury restaurants will steal your taste buds away. Enjoy your afternoons or evenings here with some good window shopping or even shopping.

title: Good mall but exits to parking floors a concern
review_text: Very well done mall and good blend of shopping experience and restaurants. Ample amount of parking but to get to the mall from parking is a big struggle as there are very few lifts and entry is not on every floor to the mall. More signages required.

title: Entertainment and Luxury
review_text: Multiplexes are a common phenomenon in India today...Kolkata is not an an exception. Took my 6 yrs old son to watch Amazing Spiderman 2 to Inox at Quest Mall. Chose the Insignia Lounge as the venue for the movie. The waiting lounge was nice and comfortable...but lots more was still to come. As we were greeted into the theatre, the spacious interiors really brought a smile to our faces. The seats were the next surprise. My son was elated to find the seats that were soooo comfortable with sliding leg rests and extremely soothing couches. The extra sized tables were a delight and great help with the super delicious caramel popcorn.....coffee can be improved though. The best place by far in town to watch that rare movie by the rare movie watcher. More

title: Brand new Mall, good location
review_text: A mall so close to the heart of the city and brand new: what more do you need to chill out on a hot summer day. Indeed, a lot of international brands to choose from. By Kolkata standards, it is spacious and looks quite attractive- both inside and out. Well connected by bus, tram and auto. No nearest Metro though. The Food Court at the top is nice though it gets crowded at peak hours. It is not that kind of swanky mall that you may find in Gurgaon or Delhi but as I mentioned, by Kolkata standards, it is nice. I would go back again for all my shopping and other needs. The movie theatre is also the first of its kind in Kolkata- what money can offer. As of now, there is no other nearby Mall to challenge it in any way. More
